page.title: 12Ufton Fields Nature Reserve.
page.content: Ufton Fields Nature Reserve is an area of about 77 acres which used to be limestone quarries in the early 1950's.The land was partly reclaimed by planting large numbers of trees particularly Poplars,Conifers & Alders. In 1971 {WARWICKSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL} took over management as a local nature reserve.Since that time the reserve has been managed by the Warwickshire Nature Conservation Trust (WARNACT) on behalf of the County Council.The main features of western part are parallel spoil ridges and numerous pools.Eastern parts are wooded,flat and marshy. Access is restricted to the public footpath except for permit holders.Digging,reed pulling,hedging etc is done in winter,while surveys and studies are carried out according to a plan.
